alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 5:13PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MST/830 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MST /830 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 PM MST /611 PM MDT/, trained weather spotters reported flooding in the advisory area. Rapid river rises have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Porter Creek, Hog Wash, Show Low Creek, Silver Creek, Billy Creek, Linden Draw and Walnut Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Show Low, Wagon Wheel, Lake Of The Woods--Pinetop-lakeside, Fool Hollow Lake Campground, Scott Reservoir Campground and Lakeside Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 336 and 350. Highway 60 between mile markers 340 and 341. State Route 77 between mile markers 354 and 355. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
